list_definition.definition: a person’s characteristics (of the mind, the emotions etc) as a whole

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She is not beautiful, but she has a lot of personality.
(also adjective) a personality cult (= very great, usually too great, admiration for a person, usually a political leader).

list_ex_of_english: There might even be instances in which, because of their personalities, there is no psychological harm to either party.
A sociological study of this remarkable change in public attitudes would be rewarding, and should be undertaken before the events and personalities are forgotten.
The contrasting personalities of the fitness-instructors influenced how they interpreted their particular training curriculum.
They become more ideals through their personalities, and at any rate something of a block has existed against looking too much.
He held that individuals with flexible, resilient and self-aware personalities were most likely to benefit from reviewing their past through reminiscence.
Rather, a complex mixture of economic factors, local tensions, and individual personalities combined in attacks on specific individuals.
Competent teachers with non-discouraging personalities using nondefensive methods and techniques, who cherish their students and hold them in unconditional positive regard, are the best teachers.
Indeed, one might reasonably suspect that the sample is over-representative of obsessive-compulsive personalities.
